result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. William J Groh

records.addlTxt: Routed to JA/FCC for further review. (ae/11/1/22)

[ma] Cases 22CF360 & 22CF370 called at 9:15 AM 
Defendant William J Groh in court.  Attorney Brian William Severson in court for William J Groh.  Attorney Michael Witt  in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Witt verifies victim rights compliance. 

As to Both 22CF360 & 22CF370, Waiver of Preliminary Hearing occurs: 
Mr. Groh waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

recess: 9:20am  

NEXT:  Arraignment on 11/15/22 at 1:30pm

Pre-trial conference on September 14, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Adjustment Number: 22A 185982,
Payable Number: 194841,
Receipt Number: 22R 015926,
Amount: $20.00

[MK] case called at 8:38am 
Defendant William J Groh in court with Attorney Brian Severson.  DA Monica Hall in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
DA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.
Attorney Severson indicates that he will file the Notice of Retainer later today. 
Both parties waive preliminary hearing time limits. 
On request of the Defense, the Court modifies the Bond to allow an exception to the contact prohibition and no presence conditions of Bond:   the Defendant is allowed to return to the subject property in the escort of law enforcement to retrieve what is legally and personally his. Law enforcement will permit the Defendant no less than 8 hours and no more than 12 hours to do this. Law enforcement does need to be there during this time.  
recess 8:41am. 

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on September 14th at 11:00am, (2) Preliminary Hearing on October 11th at 9:00am
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Adjourned initial appearance on September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

[ma] Case called at 1:19 PM 
Defendant William J Groh appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, along with Public Defender Jeffrey De La Rosa(PD appears for bond-purposes only).  Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin. 
The Court finds that the video-connection is sight and sound sufficient. 

The Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Right to Counsel reviewed.
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charges and maximum penalties are recited.
Atty Flint verifies victim rights compliance
The Court tolls time limits

Bond Arguments given by Counsel

The Court requires a $10,000  Signature Bond with conditions:
--no contact with Victim 1, sale of home/real estate may be discussed through Agent
--no presence at residence of Victim 1 or any location temporarily occupied by Victim 1
--not to post any photos or videos on social media with people other than himself depicted
--not to discuss the facts of case or any person involved in case on social media
--maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--not to leave the State of Wisconsin
recess 1:31  pm. 

NEXT: Adjourned Initial Appearance on 9/1/22 at 8:30am
